concept.title: How to start a heartbeat timer
concept.shortdesc: Provides code snippet to show you how to start a heartbeat timer.

conbody.p: A heartbeat timer, CHeartbeat, invokes a function at regular intervals. You must define a class that implements the MBeating interface to define:

li.p: a function Beat() that is called if the heartbeat timer is in synchronisation with the system clock
a function Synchronize() that is called if the heartbeat timer has got out of synchronisation with the system clock

conbody.p: First, we define a class CHeartbeatRunner class that derives from MBeating.
Then, we can start the heartbeat timer. We pass the time interval for the beats (allowable intervals are defined in 1/12s of a second by TTimerLockSpec), and the object implementing MBeating.
